metadata.Title: CVE-2021-0129 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: Improper access control in BlueZ may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable information disclosure via adjacent access. It was discovered that the bluetooth subsystem in the Linux kernel did not properly perform access control. An authenticated attacker could possibly use this to expose sensitive information.

criterions.comment: bluez: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
